SEARCH
Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab

Class TextureArrayColorfulBatch

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.ColorfulBatch
com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab.TextureArrayColorfulBatch
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
public class TextureArrayColorfulBatch extends ColorfulBatch
Draws batched quads using indices. Like ColorfulBatch, this adds another attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, but also has optimizations when rendering from multiple Textures. This maintains an LFU texture-cache to combine draw calls with different textures effectively.
Use this Batch if you frequently utilize more than a single texture between calling begin() and end(). An example would be if your Atlas is spread over multiple Textures or if you draw with individual Textures. This version is compatible with OpenGL ES 2.0.
See Also:
  • Batch
  • SpriteBatch
  • ColorfulBatch

      Used to capture the log of any errors during shader compilation.

    • TWEAK_RESET

      public static final float TWEAK_RESET
      A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with ColorfulBatch.setTweak(float) to make all the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the lightness multiplier or lightness contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.

    • currentTextureLFUSize

      protected int currentTextureLFUSize
      The current number of textures in the LFU cache. Gets reset when calling begin()

    • currentTextureLFUSwaps

      protected int currentTextureLFUSwaps
      The current number of texture swaps in the LFU cache. Gets reset when calling begin()

    • vertexShader

      public static final String vertexShader
      The default shader's vertex part.
      This is meant to be used with fragmentShader.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • fragmentShader

      public static final String fragmentShader
      The default shader's fragment part.
      This must have the String @maxTextureUnits@ replaced with the value of maxTextureUnits at runtime. This is done by createDefaultShader(int, String, String), but not if you create a ShaderProgram yourself.
      This is meant to be used with vertexShader or vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint and passed to TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint

      public static final String vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint
      A special-purpose vertex shader meant for use only here in the Oklab ColorfulBatch, this can be used to create a ShaderProgram and passed into the constructor or setShader(ShaderProgram). Using this vertex shader lets you specify the batch color (or the tint) as a "normal" RGBA color, while using Oklab for the tweak. The fragment shader doesn't need to be modified here, so you can use fragmentShader as normal.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TextureArrayColorfulBatch

      public TextureArrayColorfulBatch(int size, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram defaultShader) throws IllegalStateException
      Constructs a new TextureArrayColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with respect to the current screen resolution.

      The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than the ones expect for shaders set with setShader(ShaderProgram).

      Parameters:
      size - The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 8191.
      defaultShader - The default shader to use. This is not owned by the TextureArrayColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - Thrown if the device does not support texture arrays. Make sure to implement a Fallback to ColorfulBatch in case Texture Arrays are not supported on a client's device.
      See Also:
      • createDefaultShader(int, String, String)
      • getMaxTextureUnits()

  • Method Details

    • createDefaultShader

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram createDefaultShader(int maxTextureUnits)
      Returns a new instance of the default shader used by TextureArrayColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified. This overload always uses vertexShader and fragmentShader to make its ShaderProgram. This ignores ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode and ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode. Instead, it sets the GLSL version of the shader code automatically to 100 or 150, as appropriate.
      Parameters:
      maxTextureUnits - look this up once with getMaxTextureUnits() for the current hardware
      Returns:
      the default ShaderProgram for this Batch
      See Also:
      • getMaxTextureUnits()

    • createDefaultShader

      public static com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram createDefaultShader(int maxTextureUnits, String vertex, String fragment)
      Returns a new instance of the default shader used by TextureArrayColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified. Does not have any #version specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used for the tweak, and handles its own extra attribute internally for the current texture index. If the fragment shader contains the String @maxTextureUnits@, that will be replaced by the value of the parameter maxTextureUnits, and this should be done at runtime by this class. This ignores ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode and ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode. Instead, it sets the GLSL version of the shader code automatically to 100 or 150, as appropriate.
      Parameters:
      maxTextureUnits - look this up once with getMaxTextureUnits() for the current hardware
      vertex - typically vertexShader, but can also be vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint or user-defined
      fragment - typically fragmentShader, but can also be user-defined
      Returns:
      the default ShaderProgram for this Batch
      See Also:
      • getMaxTextureUnits()

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count)
      Description copied from class: ColorfulBatch
      This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24 floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch
      Overrides:
      draw in class ColorfulBatch
      Parameters:
      texture - the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
      spriteVertices - not the same format as ColorfulBatch.vertices in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
      offset - where to start drawing vertices from spriteVertices
      count - how many vertices to draw from spriteVertices (20 vertices is one sprite)

    • drawExactly

      public void drawExactly(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count)
      Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex, this is just like draw(Texture, float[], int, int) when used in other Batch implementations, but expects spriteVertices to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
      Overrides:
      drawExactly in class ColorfulBatch
      Parameters:
      texture - the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
      spriteVertices - vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
      offset - where to start drawing vertices from spriteVertices
      count - how many vertices to draw from spriteVertices (24 vertices is one sprite)

    • getMaxTextureUnits

      public static int getMaxTextureUnits()
      Queries the number of supported textures in a texture array by trying to create the default shader.
      The first call of this method is very expensive, after that it simply returns a cached value.
      Returns:
      the number of supported textures in a texture array or zero if this feature is unsupported on this device.
      See Also:
      • setShader(ShaderProgram shader)

    • setShader

      public void setShader(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram shader)
      Sets the shader to be used in a GLES 2.0 environment. Vertex position attribute is called "a_position", the texture coordinates attribute is called "a_texCoord0", the color attribute is called "a_color", texture unit index is called "a_texture_index", this needs to be converted to int with int(...) in the fragment shader. See ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE and ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE which gets "0" appended to indicate the use of the first texture unit. The combined transform and projection matrix is uploaded via a mat4 uniform called "u_projTrans". The texture sampler array is passed via a uniform called "u_textures", see createDefaultShader(int) for reference.

      Call this method with a null argument to use the default shader.

      This method will flush the batch before setting the new shader, you can call it in between begin() and end().

      Specified by:
      setShader in interface com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch
      Overrides:
      setShader in class ColorfulBatch
      Parameters:
      shader - the ShaderProgram or null to use the default shader.
      See Also:
      • createDefaultShader(int)
      • getMaxTextureUnits()

    • getShader

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram getShader()
      Specified by:
      getShader in interface com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch
      Overrides:
